answers.question: What language learning resources are available for Ukrainian refugees?
answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can access Romanian language courses from IOM, Centrul de Tineret FNT, and JRS Romania, as well as English courses from Centrul de Tineret FNT. Additional resources include a Romanian Phrase Book, a Romanian video language course from TVR1, the 'Romanian Language for Ukrainians' manual from UNHCR, and Romanian Language handbooks created by Terre des hommes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.question: What other support services are offered to Ukrainian refugees?
answers.answer: Other support services include art therapy, music lessons, yoga, stretching, and history classes from Centrul de Tineret FNT. JRS Romania offers chess, drawing classes, and social and legal consultations. The Ukrainian Educational Center provides educational, developmental, creative, sports activities, and psychological support, and a coloring book titled 'Heroes Cry Too' is available for children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.question: How can Ukrainian refugees access these resources?
answers.answer: Refugees can register for IOM courses at their Bucharest offices or via email. For Centrul de Tineret FNT, information and sign-up are available on their Facebook page or by phone. JRS Romania's schedule and contacts are on their Facebook group, website, or via phone/email. The Ukrainian Educational Center can be accessed by contacting Olga Gireada by phone, provided children have temporary protection status and are located in or near Bucharest. Other resources like phrase books and manuals are accessible online or via provided links.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.question: What age groups are these resources designed for?
answers.answer: Resources are generally available for children and adults. Specifically, IOM and JRS Romania courses are for adults, while Centrul de Tineret FNT activities are for people aged 14-35. The Ukrainian Educational Center and the 'Heroes Cry Too' coloring book are for children. Romanian language handbooks are available for Ukrainian teenagers, children, and people of all ages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.

answers.question: When are these services available?
answers.answer: IOM offices are open Monday to Friday, from 9:00 to 17:00. JRS Romania classes run from Monday to Friday. The Ukrainian Educational Center operates from 08:00 to 13:00. Centrul de Tineret FNT offers a weekly program, with the specific class schedule available on their official Facebook page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng and read the page carefully.
